overview_of_class: In this course, students will learn about the logic of inquiry in archaeology - key theories, concepts and approaches; characteristic habits of thought; techniques and intuitions. In particular, we will discuss how archaeology articulates with the other sub-fields of anthropology. We will approach the subject through the basic dimensions of archaeological enquiry (and, arguably, most enquiry in the human sciences): space, time, materiality, and the relationship between present and past. Student will write a final paper applying what they have learnt to a specific topic in their research.
name: Logic of Inquiry in Anthropology (Archy)
subject: ANTHRO
